categories.name: announcements
categories.description: The place for all Discourse announcements.
categories.description_text: The place for all Discourse announcements.

categories.name: blog
categories.description: Discussion topics generated from the official Discourse Blog. These topics are linked from the bottom of each blog entry where the blog comments would normally be.
categories.description_text: Discussion topics generated from the official Discourse Blog. These topics are linked from the bottom of each blog entry where the blog comments would normally be.
categories.description_excerpt: Discussion topics generated from the official Discourse Blog. These topics are linked from the bottom of each blog entry where the blog comments would normally be.

categories.name: documentation
categories.description: Documentation for how to use Discourse, install and configure sites, and troubleshoot common issues. Includes topics for tutorials, how-tos, general reference and troubleshooting. Topics need to be created in one of the subcategories, and may only be created by trust level 2 and up.
categories.description_text: Documentation for how to use Discourse, install and configure sites, and troubleshoot common issues. Includes topics for tutorials, how-tos, general reference and troubleshooting. Topics need to be created in one of the subcategories, and may only be created by trust level 2 and up.
categories.description_excerpt: Documentation for how to use Discourse, install and configure sites, and troubleshoot common issues. Includes topics for tutorials, how-tos, general reference and troubleshooting. Topics need to be created in one of the subcategories, and may only be created by trust level 2 and up.

categories.name: wordpress
categories.description: Support for the official Discourse WordPress plugin at GitHub - discourse/wp-discourse: WordPress plugin that lets you use Discourse as the community engine for a WordPress blog
categories.description_text: Support for the official Discourse WordPress plugin at GitHub - discourse/wp-discourse: WordPress plugin that lets you use Discourse as the community engine for a WordPress blog
categories.description_excerpt: Support for the official Discourse WordPress plugin at GitHub - discourse/wp-discourse: WordPress plugin that lets you use Discourse as the community engine for a WordPress blog

categories.name: bug
categories.description: A bug report means something is broken, preventing normal/typical use of Discourse. Do be sure to search prior to submitting bugs. Include repro steps, and only describe one bug per topic please.
categories.description_text: A bug report means something is broken, preventing normal/typical use of Discourse. Do be sure to search prior to submitting bugs. Include repro steps, and only describe one bug per topic please.
categories.description_excerpt: A bug report means something is broken, preventing normal/typical use of Discourse. Do be sure to search prior to submitting bugs. Include repro steps, and only describe one bug per topic please.

categories.name: ux
categories.description: Discussion about the user interface of Discourse and how features are presented (including language and UI elements).
categories.description_text: Discussion about the user interface of Discourse and how features are presented (including language and UI elements).
categories.description_excerpt: Discussion about the user interface of Discourse and how features are presented (including language and UI elements).

categories.name: feature
categories.description: Discussion about existing Discourse features, how they can be improved or enhanced, and how proposed new features could work.

categories.description_excerpt: Discussion about existing Discourse features, how they can be improved or enhanced, and how proposed new features could work.

categories.name: data & reporting
categories.description: This is the category for everything related to Discourse data and reporting. Here, you can discuss dashboard reports, custom badge queries, data-explorer queries and any other analytic add-ons.
categories.description_text: This is the category for everything related to Discourse data and reporting. Here, you can discuss dashboard reports, custom badge queries, data-explorer queries and any other analytic add-ons.
categories.description_excerpt: This is the category for everything related to Discourse data and reporting. Here, you can discuss dashboard reports, custom badge queries, data-explorer queries and any other analytic add-ons.

categories.description: For queries specifically about SSO (single sign-on) and login using third-party providers (Google, Facebook, GitHub etc). See the official documentation on DiscourseConnect SSO.

categories.name: community
categories.description: A great platform doesn’t guarantee success. Community building is a science. This category is for discussions about launching, building, growing and managing a thriving community.

What would you like done?

When do you need it done?

What is your budget, in $ USD that you can offer for this task?

categories.name: forum summaries
categories.description: Stay up-to-date with the pulse of our community through AI-crafted summaries.  This category harnesses the power of artificial intelligence to collate and condense forum activities, providing you with comprehensive yet succinct overviews. From emerging discussions to trending topics, our AI summaries deliver the essence of the Discourse community’s heartbeat, right at your fingertips.
